article:
A 'whitesmith' is a person who works with "white" or light-coloured metals such
as tin and pewter. Unlike blacksmiths (who work mostly with hot metal),
whitesmiths do the majority of their work on cold metal (although they might use
a hearth to heat and help shape their raw materials). The term is also applied
to metalworkers who do only finishing work â such as filing or polishing â on
iron and other "black" metals. Whitesmiths fabricate items such as tin or pewter
cups, water pitchers, forks, spoons, and candle holders and it was a common
occupation in pre-industrial times. For information on how blacksmiths work
metal, visit metalworking.
